alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Floyd; Lubbock; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 10 at 10:12PM CDT until May 10 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LUBBOCK...NORTHWESTERN DICKENS...SOUTHERN FLOYD... CROSBY AND SOUTHWESTERN MOTLEY COUNTIES... At 1011 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Floydada to near Dougherty to 4 miles southeast of Mcadoo, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...75 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 1004 PM CDT, the West Texas Mesonet at McAdoo measured a wind gust of 73 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Floydada, Crosbyton, Matador, White River Lake, Ralls, Lorenzo, Cone, Dougherty, Afton, Mcadoo, and Roaring Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
